virtual.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: Car ownership is a virtual necessity when you live in the country.
Finding a cheap place to rent is a virtual impossibility in this area.
virtual.translation[0].definitions[1].de: made, done, seen etc on the Internet or on a computer, rather than in the real world
virtual.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: The website allows you to take a virtual tour of the art gallery.
virtual.translation[1].definitions[0].de: a virtual monopoly, ban, takeover etc is so nearly a complete monopoly, ban etc that any difference is unimportant
virtual.translation[1].definitions[0].ex: They enjoy a virtual monopoly in sales of pickup trucks.
Trading activity reached a virtual standstill.
virtual.translation[1].definitions[1].de: computer software that gives you the experience of being in a place, or allows you to do the things that you would do in a real office, library etc
virtual.translation[1].definitions[1].ex: In a virtual library, people can explore information resources from their desks.
virtual.translation[1].definitions[2].de: a document etc that exists on a computer rather than in physical form
virtual.translation[1].definitions[2].ex: Buying an air ticket involves the creation of several virtual documents.
